sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The heads of the petition.
1 sheet ([1] p.)
s.n., [London : 1647]
Imprint from Wing. The apprentices and journeymen of London state that they are in favor of the establishment of Presbyterianism and would like to see the disbandment and payment of the army; they also request that the sale of freedoms and intrusions to foreigners into trade be stopped -- Cf. Steele. Annotation on Thomason copy: "The Apprentices and Journeymans Petition to ye Parlement"; "London. 8 July. 1647". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

s.n., [London : 1647]
Imprint from Wing. The apprentices and journeymen of London state that they are in favor of the establishment of Presbyterianism and would like to see the disbandment and payment of the army; they also request that the sale of freedoms and intrusions to foreigners into trade be stopped -- Cf. Steele. Annotation on Thomason copy: "The Apprentices and Journeymans Petition to ye Parlement"; "London. 8 July. 1647". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
>>>>>>> imprintparse
